definition: precipitation in the form of small white ice crystals formed directly from the water vapor of the air at a temperature of less than 32°F (0°C)
a descent or shower of snow crystals
a mass of fallen snow crystals
something resembling snow: such as

a dessert made of stiffly beaten whites of eggs, sugar, and fruit pulp                                      
             
             apple snow

a usually white crystalline substance that condenses from a fluid phase as snow does                                      
             
             ammonia snow
cocaine
heroin
small transient light or dark spots on a television screen
to fall in or as snow
to cause to fall like or as snow
to cover, shut in, or imprison with or as if with snow
to deceive, persuade, or charm glibly
to whiten like snow
C(harles) P(ercy) 1905–1980 Baron Snow English novelist and physicist
soft, white pieces of frozen water that fall to the ground from the sky in cold weather
white dots that appear on the screen of a television when it is receiving a weak signal
—used with it to say that snow is falling
to impress, deceive, or persuade (someone)
small white crystals of ice formed directly from the water vapor of the air

a mass of snowflakes fallen to earth                                      
             
             a foot of snow

to fall or cause to fall in or as snow                                      
             
             It's snowing west of here.

any of various congealed or crystallized substances resembling snow in appearance                                      
             
             carbon dioxide snow
in: apple snow
ammonia snow
Snow fell softly on the town.
The mountains were blanketed with snow.
She took a walk in the snow.
We haven't had much snow this year.
She went out to shovel the snow.
Soon the warm spring sun will melt the winter snows.
the snows of the Rocky Mountains
A light snow was falling.
easily snowed by her glib talk
the years had snowed his hair to a silvery white, making it difficult at first to recognize her old high school crush
a foot of snow
It's snowing west of here.
carbon dioxide snow

definition: small soft white pieces of ice that fall from the sky and cover the ground
the snow that falls over a period of time
cocaine
in: Two to three inches of snow is predicted for tonight.
The path was hidden under a blanket of snow.
There had been a heavy fall of snow.
The first snows of winter are here.

a single fall of snow:

to deceive or trick someone by talking a lot or by giving them a lot of information:
water that falls from clouds as soft, white flakes (= thin pieces) of ice when it is cold, or an amount of these flakes:

to have more work than you can deal with:
